intro: Euthamia leptocephala, commonly known as narrowhead goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Its slender, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit make it a distinctive member of its ecological community.
